entry.title: webui: detect when the preloaded contents is ready to show
entry.content:
A top chrome WebUI page notifies its embedder when it is ready to be

shown by calling MojoBubbleWebUIController::Embedder::ShowUI(). This

patch captures this signal in the preload manager, when the page is not

yet attached to any views.



WebUIPreloadManager::MakeContents() now returns a struct that contains

the preloaded WebContents and an "is_ready_to_show" boolean. This will

later be used in WebUIBubbleManager to skip page reloading if the page

is already ready to show.



Bug: 325928324

Change-Id: I3e89a5159db04de54d3c1de0a418c027f5c1dfcf

entry.title: [ios] Do not report form activity for each removed form
entry.content:
There is an unnecessary form activity notified when there is a removed

form notified.



This is because in the old logic, we would return whenever a form

activity was found, but now we can batch up to 2 form activities, so

the code needs to handle that.



Using .forEach simplifies the comprehension of the loop, and it

represents a speed improvement as tested on

http://shortn/_LkVWu57qsr



The form activity case at the end of the loop had to be notified only

if there weren't removed form detected before.



Bug: 325415935

Change-Id: I1514057bd110bb405279841304e2e963f4506bb3

entry.title: Implement Safe Browsing Interstitial UKM
entry.content:
To help us accurately understand how safe browsing interstitial events

occur in relation to other events (such as users accepting notification

permissions for a site), we want to add a UKM that logs occurrences of

the two events: Safe Browsing interstitial shown and user proceeds past

interstitial. See the UKM collection doc [1] and UKM data usage

doc[2] for more details.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CRC_8zRzbAjMT7Rbfmt6cdqJLHELZzP6O9tfVlohsbs

[2] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dht3-0s5BXbGQt75i3GSJrrRjpO14WcGxSz5LX9Bo3c

entry.title: Mahi: Create ReadWriteCardsUiController and add Mahi view
entry.content:
Create ReadWriteCardsUiController, which creates and manages the

widget that hosts both quick answers and mahi cards shown alongside the

context menu. Right now, the controller will have the capabilities of

adding/removing quick answers/mahi views and show/hide the widget

accordingly. Widget bounds calculation will be added in the next CL.



This CL also adds the Mahi view to this widget when text is selected.



A new directory //c/b/ui/read_write_cards is also created to contain

all the logic related to ReadWriteCards, more classes from quick_answers

and editor_menu will be moved to this directory in future CLs.



Design doc: http://go/mahi-ui-dd#heading=h.4crzadrm7qmm



Bug: b:327966577, b:324646785

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Migrate NearbyPresenceService::PresenceDevice
entry.content:
`NearbyPresenceService::PresenceDevice` (NPS::PD) was originally created

before the library representation of PresenceDevice was completed. This

change removes the usage of NPS::PD and replaces it with the Nearby

library's implementation.



Note that doing so removes the RSSI and Stable Device ID information, as

that's currently not being tracked in the library implementation. A

future CL will either re-introduce it into the library if that data is

still needed OR remove those fields from the mojom::PresenceDevice

if they are no longer needed.



Fixed: b/327278661

Test: Unit tests updated

Change-Id: I95f37d5d5abbad59f6a172fffe60d8f01d14e514

entry.title: Resolve percentages for relative color channels with calc()
entry.content:
Extend ConsumeRelativeColorChannel() to be able to handle additional

categories of calc() results - and . In the latter

case resolve against the base specified in the specification for each

color function.



Move per-function metadata to a table structure - containing the list of

channel keywords and the percentage bases for each channel. Use this

table to also simplify the existing resolution of percentage values.

entry.title: Log AndroidTelemetryService referrer chain metrics at ping generation
entry.content:
The AndroidTelemetryService currently observes all downloads, then only

does anything with a small fraction of them. This means that

https://crrev.com/c/5318781 began computing referrer chains for all

downloads, and logging metrics for all downloads. This is not the intent

of the metrics, so instead persist the result of referrer chain

computation so we can log it only when we decide to send a ping.



Bug: 324293877

Change-Id: I661f792f14e8b3c852b37b8e3661ad63cea9e02e

entry.title: Introduce common SearchActivity call-up mechanism.
entry.content:
This change introduces a SearchActivityClient, a standalone interface

that permits components to call up SearchActivity.



The component allows us to provide a simple scalable solution for all

SearchActivity use cases. The intention is to migrate multiple

different invocation mechanisms to a single, easily expandable

mechanism that can encompass them all.

entry.title: Dismiss Apps Collections view context menu sorting
entry.content:
This cl allows the AppsCollections page to receive right click events.

A right click will trigger to show the AppsGridContextMenu, which allows

users to sort the regular apps grid. In the context of the Apps

Collections view, the menu will have the same elements as the regular

apps grid, but instead of snapping into and ordered AppsGridView, a

confirmation dialog will request input from the user, letting them know

that the sorting action will result in the tutorial view dismissal.



After accepting the dialog, the user will be shown the regular apps

grid, as if it was sorted by they elected choice.

entry.title: Remove Memory.System.AvailableMB histogram
entry.content:
The histogram "Memory.System.AvailableMB" is recorded every 5 secs on

Windows (http://crrev.com/c/4200608). This is causing lock contention

inside base::StatisticsRecorder::FindHistogram. We are seeing some jank

instances on UI thread, especially on low to mid range devices (RAM 2GB

to 6GB). During code review, it was pointed out that this histogram is

redundant, hence removing it.



Memory.System.AvailableMB histogram is redundant with

Memory.Experimental.AvailableMemoryMB (cross-platform) which is recorded

here: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/performance_manager/metrics/metrics_provider_desktop.cc;l=244;drc=bb3b7c5fa491b98146018d70a6e7a0b5e70be0a2

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: Add NativePixmap support to VideoDecoderPipeline
entry.content:
VideoPipeline needs to output a VideoFrame. When VideoDecoderPipeline

doesn't have a converter set, this change adds support for creating a

GMB VideoFrame from a NativePixmapFrameResource.



NativePixmapFrameResource::CreateVideoFrame() clones the

NativePixmapHandle from the underlying NativePixmap and uses that to

create a VideoFrame.

entry.title: [Default Nav Transition] Implement the UX for BeforeUnload handler
entry.content:
The UX is: as long as the browser sends out the BeforeUnload IPC to the

renderer, we play the cancel animation to bring back the active page,

even if the renderer decides to not show the prompt at all (e.g., if

the page doesn't have a sticky user activation).



In real world testing, the IPC exchange is so fast (in the case where

the renderer doesn't show the prompt and acks to proceed) that the

cancel animation never gets to play a single frame (even on a debug

build). This is close the the ideal UX mentioned below.



Ideally we want to only play the cancel animation if the renderer

decides to show the prompt. While this is a better UX, it makes the

impl complicated as we need to decide what to show after the user lifts

the finger and before the renderer asks the browser to draw the prompt.

(presumably the invoke animation, then plays the cancel animation when

the renderer acks to show the prompt).



Alternatively, we could let the browser not send out the BeforeUnload

message if we know that the renderer for sure will always ack with

proceed. RFHI::HasStickyUserActivation already has the information,

though the source of truth is passed from the renderer. However we

don't really know the complication of changing the BeforeUnload flow

so this current impl is the best option for now.



Bug: 1421009

Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: Add NativePixmapFrameResource
entry.content:
NativePixmapFrameResource is composed of a NativePixmapDmaBuf and

VideoFrame metadata members. It presents a VideoFrame::StorageType of

STORAGE_DMABUF and provides file descriptor accessors.



It can be constructed by assuming ownership over a vector of per-plane

file descriptors (which will be used to import V4L2 buffers), by

allocating the planes using MiniGBM, or by assuming ownership of a

NativePixmapDmaBuf.



The method WrapFrame is used to create a new FrameResource that is

backed by the same NativePixmapDmaBuf, but with caller specified visible

rectangle, and a copy of the VideoFrame metadata, which can be modified.



The conversion method CreateVideoFrame() produces a VideoFrame with a

storage type of STORAGE_GPU_MEMORY_BUFFER with duplicated file

descriptors.



There are two changes to functions in platform_video_frame_utils.h to

expose functionality that is needed by the implementation of

NativePixmapFrameResource:



1. AllocateGpuMemoryBufferHandle() creates a NativePixmap and returns a

GpuMemoryBufferHandle that refers to it. It does so by utilizing a GBM

wrapper that is scoped just to platform_video_frame_utils.cc. In order

for NativePixmapFrameResource to have a Create function that uses

MiniGBM to allocate frames, the function has been moved out of an

anoynmous namespace and is now declared in platform_frame_utils.h.



2. CreateGpuMemoryBufferVideoFrame() allocates a GMBHandle and creates a

VideoFrame with storage type of STORAGE_GPU_MEMORY_BUFFER from it. This

extracts the VideoFrame creation logic into a new function:

CreateVideoFrameFromGpuMemoryBufferHandle(). The new function is called

by the original CreateGpuMemoryBufferVideoFrame() function and is also

used by NativePixmapFrameResource::CreateVideoFrame().

entry.title: Merge the layer structs in highlight painting
entry.content:
HighlightPainter;:LayerPaintState and HighlightOverlay::HighlightLayer

have a 1-1 relationship. Merge them and move paint style calculation

into HighlightOverlay::ComputeLayers so that the information will be

available in ComputeParts to correctly set paint style for parts

(which we currently do incorrectly).



In the process also change the storage of layer information in

the other HighlightOverlay structures to simplify finding layers

at paint time.



This is the final preparatory CL to actually fixing the issue.

entry.title: [Cast Convergence] Remove is_castos = true builders from try jobs.
entry.content:
This is part 1/3 of a multi-part change to update Cast Linux builders

in Chromium. The is_castos flag is no longer supported in upstream

Chrome.



The following builders will be turned down:

- Cast Linux ARM64 / linux-arm64-castos

- Cast Linux Debug / linux-x64-castos-dbg

- Cast Linux / linux-x64-castos



They will be replaced with roughly the following:



- linux-arm64-cast-rel (for validating builds pushed to devices)

- linux-x64-cast-dbg (for validating that desktop builds work)



Some, but not all of the test suites for the old builders will be

re-used for the new builders. The unused suites will be deleted in a

followup CL.



Android and Fuchsia cast builders remain unaffected.



Bug: 1516671

entry.title: [//media] RenderableGMBVideoFramePool get texture target from ClientSI
entry.content:
This CL converts RenderableGMBVideoFramePool away from overriding the

texture target to use on MacOS only to call

ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTargetForOverlays(), which has identical

semantics to the current flow:



* Returns GetPlatformSpecificTextureTarget() on Mac

* Return GL_TEXTURE_2D otherwise



This is a step on the road to the eventual goal of having all client

texture target computation behind a universal

ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget() function.



This CL also removes a now-obsolete TODO from this code.



Note: There is existing weirdness in this code with the texture target

of the MailboxHolders sometimes getting set and sometimes not in the

case where the ClientSharedImage was not successfully created. This

CL does not attempt to fix that code, although we should separately.

entry.title: Skip codepoints not participating in grammar for emoji segmentation
entry.content:
Skip forward in SymbolsIterator when codepoints do not participate in

the segmentation grammar. This is based on and an iteration over an idea

that Koji initially brought forward as an extra pre-scan step [1]. This

way we can avoid the pre-scan step. Instead we fold the logic into the

SymbolsIterator.



SymbolsIterator uses the Ragel generated scanner code to identify emoji

sequences. Because of characteristics of the grammar, it needed to

restart at every next token. But we can skip scanning for tokens /

codepoints that do not participate in the grammar. This means a

significant speedup, as we no longer need to keep recreating the Ragel

scanner state for each token.



This brings a ~4% improvement on blink.perf-layout tests: japanese-kokoro-insert, editing_*, and CJK-article. 1.4% improvement on

Editor-TipTap.



Together with a subsequent change to accelerate the `UTF16RagelIterator`, this leads to a 2.1% speedup in Editor-TipTap and an overall speedometer3 score improvement of 0.1%. Figures from pinpoint for the combination of those two changes in [2].



Thanks to Behdad Esfahbod for an inspiring discussion, and the

suggestion to look into the SymbolsIterator scanning loop instead of

only making the UTF16RagelIterator faster.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5276771

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366205



Bug: 41495057

Change-Id: I7ad112ca2cca23d959656851e768e8749478968e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5317569

Commit-Queue: Dominik Röttsches

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

entry.title: [Autofill] Eliminate AutofillClient parameter from AutofillManager
entry.content:
The ownership hierarchy on non-iOS is

ChromeAutofillClient

-> ContentAutofillDriverFactory

-> ContentAutofillDriver

-> AutofillManager



Conversely, each class points to its *direct* owner and to its

direct owner only.



There's one exception: AutofillManager::client_ points to an the

AutofillManager's indirect owner. This CL removes this pointer.



This leads to better test setups because AutofillDriver and

AutofillManager can no longer use inconsistent AutofillClients.

Test setups now also reflect the ownership hierarchy.



In iOS land it's the same except that the AutofillDriverIOSFactory

isn't owned by the ChromeAutofillClientIOS.



Bug: 40100455

Change-Id: Ia79aadd6bc3b7d527a70d55fa212ea1426397007

Cq-Do-Not-Cancel-Tryjobs: true

entry.title: Address Media Foundation Fast Forward Effect
entry.content:
When the video track is removed & subsequently re-added when using

MediaFoundationRenderer there is an issue that can occur where frames

either present in a fast forward effect or may even freeze. This

behavior may resolve with the presentation of the second key frame, but

in some cases the Media Engine gets into a negative feedback cycle

which may last for longer durations. This issue is more exacerbated when

using Hardware DRM.



This change addresses the issue by opting MediaFoundationRenderer out of removing the video track when hidden, by allowing the video frames to continue to pump to Media Foundation's Media Engine we avoid the issue. This does come as a trade off to the power savings of not demuxing & decoding the video frames, but given that MediaFoundationRenderer is focused on DRM content playback at the moment this should be an acceptable trade off.



Change-Id: Ibe49604f659c4139f5666a6e150c9f00832cf0bf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5276450

Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

Reviewed-by: Frank Li

Commit-Queue: William Carr

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1272808}

entry.title: Don't send touch moves to EventForwarder observers.
entry.content:
This is part of Input Vizard

project(https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mcydbkgFCO_TT9NuFE962L8PLJWT2XOfXUAPO88VuKE)

where we are trying to move input to GPU process. With input coming on

GPU process we would need to send back the inputs back to browser for

the observers which cannot be moved to GPU itself. We are trying to

minimize sending inputs back to Browser process to minimize the IPCs we

make.



With this change we are stopping sending touch moves to observers early

in project so that we get to know about any breaking changes early i.e.

if we need to send touch moves back to browser.



This shouldn't break the only existing observer of EventForwarder touch

events(AttributionInputEventTrackerAndroid) since it only cares about

events leading to navigations and touch moves shouldn't be causing any

navigations.



Bug: b/328602561

Change-Id: I77eb877da5b6c11fc3d9241bc91c3bd842d0f778

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5355053

Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

Commit-Queue: Kartar Singh

Reviewed-by: Stephen Nusko

entry.title: WebViewPrerender: Prerender support for AwContentsIoThreadClient
entry.content:
AwContentsIoThreadClient manages the correspondence of RFHs and Java IO

threads. Before this CL, AwContentsIoThreadClient assumed that the

FrameTreeNode associated with an RFH never change in its lifetime,

which doesn't hold in prerender activation.



This CL makes AwContentsIoThreadClient prerender-ready by adding

RenderFrameHost/FrameTree swap handling.



Note that the change is behind a feature flag kWebViewPrerender2 and

does nothing if it is disabled.



This CL is necessary for the first test of Prerender for WebView. We'll

add a test for back navigation after [2] landed.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pnf6c7jF04RpA6m_lStTKofLAb-xBoc65H_BKhy-KRE

[2] https://crrev.com/c/5269709



Credit: This CL was written by kenoss@ (not nhiroki@)

method private.

entry.title: Enable CONTACT_INFO support for @google accounts
entry.content:
Currently, CONTACT_INFO doesn't support Dasher users by disabling the

data type through its model type controller. As decided by leadership,

the special case of @google accounts (who are technically Dasher users)

should be supported.



This was supposed to be configurable via a feature parameter

kSyncEnableContactInfoDataTypeForDasherGoogleUsers of the

SyncEnableContactInfoDataTypeForDasherUsers feature flag. However, due

to a buggy implementation, this parameter is unusable: The code that

checks for the parameter is behind an

if (base::FeatureList::IsEnabled(

syncer::kSyncEnableContactInfoDataTypeForDasherUsers))

early return. Since the feature parameter cannot be set when the

associated feature is disabled, it is useless.



This CL enables support for @google accounts by removing the feature

parameter and explicitly allowing @google accounts in the model type

controller.



Change-Id: Ia04fb20d60f02467e34c91ab370da7e3e05a5c9e

entry.title: wayland: restrict event suppressing to linux window drag sessions
entry.content:
This (partially) reverts https://crrev.com/1218975, which caused

regressions in both Lacros and Linux.



After an in-depth analysis of the current impl/behavior of drag-and-drop

protocol on different Wayland compositors and having documented the

findings at [1], the plan is:



1. Land this as a short-term and low risk fix for the regressions

observed. Main reason for this is Lacros, which is under

stabilization as it is getting close to an important milestone;



2. Investigate and tentatively fix the session cancellation bug, also

documented in [1], section "Short-term fixes" item (2). The actual

fix might depend on Exo-side changes, so it needs further

investigation to tell for sure;



3. Keep working on follow-up changes outlined at [1] (Section

"Follow-ups") in order to fix drop handling, state tracking and move

event suppressing logic, if still needed, into the drag controllers

code, making them more self-contained and easier to maintain.



[1] https://notes.nickdiego.dev/chromium/wayland-events-during-drag



R=tonikitoo@igalia.com



tests using Chrome's tab dragging feature under different Wayland

compositors, including Exo (Lacros), Mutter, KWin and Sway.



Bug: 41497106, 326724593, 325309572, 327643790, 324280587, 40944743

Test: WaylandWindowDragControllerTest.* in ozone_unittests + manual

Change-Id: I312e8c6b1700699369edef4e72f4e291e2db5bee

entry.title: [mullet m3] Manual fallback on classified field with no values to fill
entry.content:
Before, if a user triggered address manual fallback on a classified

field, but there were no profiles with values to fill that field,

nothing would happen (no suggestions would be shown).



Now, suggestions will be shown in the same format of the suggestions for

unclassified fields.



Similarly for payments (including CVC, which normally isn't filled just

by itself even if the user has values stored for it).

entry.title: Accelerate `UTF16RagelIterator`
entry.content:
Improve caching: Due to the Ragel scanner using two different

UTF16RagelIterator objects, this frequently lead to situations where

we would call the character properties calls redundantly for the same

cursor position. Improve the caching logic to avoid that, by moving

the lookup to dereferencing time.



This leads to speedups of 1.77x vs 1.22x speed-up respectively in the

synthetic SymbolsIterator benchmark [1]:



Without [2], average of 3 runs of [1]:

21.033s vs. 17.337s = 1.21x speed-up



With [2], avg of 3 runs of [1]:

5.154s vs 3.064s = 1.68x speed-up



The difference between with [2]/without [2] is explained by the relative

amount of time that is spent in UTF16RagelIterator, which increases

after the optimizations in [2].



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5307975

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5317569



Bug: 41495057, 325814602

Change-Id: Id94ce034bd6b601cae65e354e74123bd9b469f7e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5317649

entry.title: Enable the Cronet Experiment Framework by default
entry.content:
Starting from this CL, Cronet will read the HTTP flags file (used for

pushing Cronet experiment flags to devices) by default on

initialization, unless explicitly disabled in the app manifest. This

effectively delivers the Cronet Experiment Framework to production and

makes it possible to use it to run real experiments on a variety of

first-party and third-party apps running on real devices in the real

world.

entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 2cad1ef4618133dc45816fc0fa72ab983d00b6b9



Diff change (Patchset 1..Patchset2):

* testSearchEngineChoiceScreenSelectThenScroll and

testSearchEngineChoiceScreenScrollThenSelect ignore the More button

for iPad.



* SearchEngineChoiceViewController computes if the More button is

needed only after -[SearchEngineChoiceViewController viewWillAppear:]

is called.



Original change's description:

> [iOS][Waffle] Fix EGTest for search engine dialog

>

> This patch updates `[SettingsAppInterface resetSearchEngine]` to

> clear kDefaultSearchProviderChoiceScreenCompletionTimestamp pref.

>

> To make FirstRunWithSearchEngineChoiceTestCase tests more reliable,

> `[SettingsAppInterface resetSearchEngine]` is called in the setUp

> and the tearDown. This is to make sure those tests won't fail and

> to clean up after the tests.

>

> Same principal about setUp and tearDown is applied to

> `SearchEngineTestCase`.

> Therefore those EGTests can be enabled:

> SearchEngineTestCase/testOpenSecondWindow

> SearchEngineTestCase/testSearchEngineChoiceScreenScrollThenSelect

entry.title: DOM: Process `<meta>` tags synchronously upon insertion
entry.content:
The HTML Standard currently processes and applies *all* `` tags

synchronously upon insertion, during the node's "insertion steps"

(indirectly).



Before this CL, Chromium would process meta tags during the

post-insertion steps however, by having HTMLMetaElement::InsertedInto()

return

`InsertionNotificationRequest::kInsertionShouldCallDidNotifySubtreeInsertions`,

so that `HTMLMetaElement::DidNotifySubtreeInsertionsToDocument()` would

be called, which would process the meta tag appropriately.



This CL simplifies the meta tag processing model to process meta tags

synchronously upon insertion (i.e., `InsertedInto()`), which passes the

remaining two relevant WPTs, and aligns the Chromium with the HTML

Standard.



The observable effect of this are:

- `` tags get applied synchronously during

insertion, such that script elements inserted atomically *after* it

can observe the document's *new* referrer policy

- `` also apply synchronously, which

means than an http-equiv value that assigns the default style sheet

ensures that the proposed style sheet is assigned synchronously. This

matches the fact that `

entry.title: Improve SharedImageFactory with GrContextType::kNone
entry.content:
When SharedImageFactory is initialized with kNone context type GPU

SharedImageBackings aren't used outside of swiftshader WebGL. Ideally

only GLTextureImageBackingFactory would be needed for swiftshader WebGL

but other factories, eg. IOSurfaceImageBackingFactory, are being used

today. Don't initialize Skia specific backing factories as a step

towards improving things.



Also fix SharedImageFactoryTests to pass in SharedContextState to avoid

having to handle null context state.

entry.title: Remove FormTracker::ignore_control_changes_
entry.content:
This data member is used to ignore the following signals if set to true:

- TextFieldDidChange

- SelectControlDidChange

- TrackAutofilledElement



Supporting Evidence:

- We only set this member in DoFillFieldWithValue, which is responsible

for single field filling, which is similar to the multiple field

filling logic present in form filling, where we do not set this

attribute



- TextFieldDidChange is called by:

- TextInput::DidSetValueByUserEdit --> Safe

- HTMLTextAreaElement::SubtreeHasChanged: This is called when the user

edits a textarea (see references of the function) and not in an

autofill flow.



- SelectControlDidChange: Select controls cannot be filled via field

filling, and during form filling we do not set this logic.



- TrackAutofilledElement: This is called by PWM and they do not set the

member to true beforehand, the member is only set to true in

AutofillAgent::DoFillFieldWithValue right before calling

WebFormControlElement::SetAutofillValue and set to false afterwards.

Moreover, this would contradict the goal of the function.



- The logic was added in

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/12260016 and was meant to fix a

mobile bug with the autofill popup. Now that the popup was replaced

with KA, the original bug is resolved without the added logic.



I also tested locally the following scenarios:

- Accepting an autocomplete suggestion

- Accepting an IBAN suggestion

- Accepting a Datalist suggestion



And all of them did not trigger any of the first three signals mentioned

in the beginning of this CL description.



Bug: 40281981, 40100455

Change-Id: Ie8afc20fa1ef6067f32ba09aaed171fc4d187c19

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5368456
